title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 5502.2 - Commutation debit card regulations
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 5502.2 - Commutation debit card regulations

State Regulations

In the use of commutation debit card, the following special
conditions are hereby established in addition to those relative to the
operation of a vehicle: (a) The card is
valid for two years from date of purchase. (b) The card must be presented to the toll
collector. (c) The commutation debit
card is not redeemable. (d) Commutation trip fare card regulations. In the use of commutation trip fare
care, the following special conditions are hereby established in addition to
those relative to the operation of a vehicle: (1)

The commutation trip fare card is only
valid for Category I vehicles, as described in section
5502.1
(c) of this

Part, which is under 8,000 lbs. (3,629 kgs.) gross weight or school buses on
regularly scheduled student pickup and delivery routes, for the first two axles
on any such vehicle or school bus. (e) The commutation debit card must be
surrendered to the toll collector upon expiration. (f) A commutation debit card which is lost
will not be replaced with a substitute by the authority. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes
R. & Regs. Tit. 21
ยง
5502.2

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
